rComments: I have also took him for summer course. Got to say it pretty tough taking Qiang over the summer because we cram through 2 or 4 chapter a day in that 4 hour class. Hard but it was worth it just to get stats out of the way. But overall if you take him during the school i recommend because its a lot easier and everyone can easy get a A.

I had him for summer session and he made the 4 hrs go by way faster.He cracks jokes, some lame, every couple of slides.He's realy helpful, but even more if he knows who you are. Make sure he knows you're name. Easy enough grader, most helpful office hours I'd ever been to. I would totally take another class with him. He gave me an A+ !!!!!
Qiang is the funniest professor ever! He and his TA Phil make a cool team. This class (aging and human brain) was both informative and entertaining, very cool.

Qiang is awesome. he took a humorous approach to teaching stats, and it really helped to remember information. let us use a note page for formulas. his accent is a little hard to get used to, but he is totally up for clarifying anything he says, just ask. :D miss you Qiang! [Winter 2008]
funniest professor ever, actually made statistics barely bearable.

The class is pretty interesting and he goes in depth about the examples.  He is pretty easy in how his exams are they are straightforward and he gives you cheat sheets. The exams are straight from his examples,homeworks so he isn't trying to trick you.  Overall experience in the class was really good.

Qiang is a very nice guy. He genuinely cares about his students. But the honest truth is that he is very disorganized. He went off on drastic tangents, and was in-effective at presenting information to the students. He gives out study guides which are the exact same questions as he uses on actual midterms. Study the guide not the lecture slides.

I really liked Qiang. He was very nice, and I enjoyed going to class. He could have made it easier by giving us step-by-step examples of how to do problems, but stats is pretty straight forward and it wasn't really necessary. I'd say that I'm not the best math student, but the study guides were pretty good and there was extra credit. Easy A!

Horrible, Horrible professor, extremely thick accent-impossible to understand, lecture slides were often so filled with grammar errors they were impossible to understand, lectured to fast, tried to make them funny, ended up making a fool of himself. Only saving grace is that the class is somewhat easy. Winter 2008 there was a girl that never shut u

he tried to make it entertaining and ended up making a fool of himself. not laugh out loud funny, but still funny to watch. the most interesting thing was to watch his reaction to an absolutely crazy girl who never shut up in class. if you were in psych 2 winter quarter 2008 you all know her. anyways easy A with available extra credit
